title: 2 killed in sniper ambush as Idaho firefighters come under siege from rifle fire
byline: Firefighters were ambushed by sniper fire while responding to a blaze in a northern Idaho mountain community Sunday, killing at least two people and unleashing barrages of gunfire over several hours in an attack the governor called a “heinous” assault.

title: World Social Media Day observed today
byline: World Social Media Day is celebrated today (June 30).

title: Several spells of showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says several spells of showers will occur in the Western, Sabaragamuwa and North-western provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts.

title: Printed book prices rise by 20% due to VAT and NBT
byline: The National Book Traders Association says that the price of printed books has increased by 20% due to the imposition of Value Added Tax (VAT) and Nation Building Tax (NBT).

title: Several senior police officers transferred with immediate effect
byline: Several senior police officers of the Sri Lanka Police have been transferred and appointed to new positions with immediate effect, the Police Media Division announced.

title: Special Parliamentary session commences
byline: A special sitting of Parliament commenced at 9:30 a.m. today (June 30).

title: SC rules certain clauses of Electricity Amendment Bill unconstitutional
byline: Announcing the Supreme Court’s determination on the Electricity Amendment Bill, the Deputy Speaker of Parliament Dr. Rizvie Salih stated that several clauses in the proposed legislation have been found to be inconsistent with the Constitution.

title: Monsoon havoc in Pakistan: Flash floods and heavy rain killed 45 in just days
byline: At least 45 people have been killed across Pakistan as heavy rain and flash floods battered multiple regions since the start of the monsoon season, disaster management officials said on Sunday.

title: Kerala cannabis valued over Rs.20 mln recovered in  Kelaniya
byline: A stock of nearly 39 kilograms of Kerala cannabis concealed in a house in Palliyawatta, Wattala, has been discovered in Kelaniya.

title: Thousands protest in Bangkok calling for Thai PM to resign
byline: Thousands of protesters have gathered in the Thai capital Bangkok, calling for the resignation of Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra after a phone call she had with the former Cambodian leader Hun Sen was leaked.

title: ASP Wootler named new Police Media Spokesperson
byline: Assistant Superintendent of Police Attorney-at-Law F.U. Wootler has been appointed as the new Police Media Spokesman.

title: Retired teacher killed in road accident in Bandaragama; two arrested
byline: A retired teacher has died while her husband has sustained injuries in a road accident in Bandaragama, police stated.

title: National mosquito control week commences
byline: The Ministry of Health (MoH) has launched the National Mosquito Control Week starting today (June 30), which will continue until July 5.

title: Reveal the plans and strategies to attract investors; Dilith Jayaweera tells Govt
byline: Without a clear strategy, a nation cannot move forward and the present administration led by the NPP has not presented any new plans to attract investments thus far, said the Leader of the ‘Sarvajana Balaya’ alliance, Member of Parliament Dilith Jayaweera.

title: Brad Pitt and ‘F1’ win in Apple’s biggest box office debut
byline: The Brad Pitt-led racing film “F1 The Movie” sped to the top of the box office this weekend, another in a string of big summer movies that Hollywood hopes will keep driving people to theaters.

title: 90-year-old Dalai Lama set to reveal succession plan
byline: The Dalai Lama will address a major three-day gathering of Buddhist religious figures this week ahead of his 90th birthday, as his followers wait for the Tibetan spiritual leader to share details about his succession in a move that could irk China.

title: Statement issued by Malwathu Maha Viharaya on false news report
byline: The Malwathu Maha Viharaya in Kandy has issued a special statement regarding a misleading news report concerning a request allegedly made by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa to the Chief Prelate of the Malwathu Chapter.

title: Indictments served against ex-Minister Lakshman Yapa
byline: Former Minister Lakshman Yapa Abeywardena and former Director General of the Board of Investment (BOI) of Sri Lanka, Jayantha Edirisinghe, were today (30) served indictments before the Colombo High Court.

title: Colombo HC to consider petition filed by ex-Minister Duminda in July
byline: The Colombo High Court has ordered that the petition filed by former Minister Duminda Dissanayake—who is currently in remand custody in connection with the seizure of a gold-plated T-56 firearm—be taken up for hearing on July 14, 2025.

title: MP Archchuna seeks govt. assurance before disclosing contents of 323 containers
byline: Member of Parliament Ramanathan Archchuna today (30) stated that he was prepared to disclose the contents of the 323 containers released recently but emphasized that the government must first provide a formal assurance that he would not be subjected to imprisonment on fabricated charges.

title: 37 red-labeled containers released without any scanning, Mujibur claims in parliament
byline: The report of the committee appointed by the President to investigate allegations regarding the release of containers without undergoing scanning was tabled in Parliament today (30) by Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) Member of Parliament Mujibur Rahman.

title: Japan launches climate change monitoring satellite on mainstay H2A rocket’s last flight
byline: Japan on Sunday successfully launched a climate change monitoring satellite on its mainstay H-2A rocket, which made its final flight before it is replaced by a new flagship model designed to be more cost competitive in the global space market.

title: India’s Adani Enterprises plans public bond sale
byline: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani’s Flagship Company aims to raise 10 billion rupees ($117 million) through the sale of retail bonds, and has filed a draft prospectus for the issue, according to statements on stock exchanges.

title: ASPI surpasses 18,000 points mark for first time ever
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) reached a historic milestone today (30) as the All Share Price Index (ASPI) surpassed the 18,000-points mark for the first time in the capital market’s history.

title: Bollywood superstar Shah Rukh Khan to visit Sri Lanka in August?
byline: World-renowned Indian film superstar Shah Rukh Khan is reportedly expected to visit Sri Lanka in August to attend the inauguration ceremony of the City of Dreams Sri Lanka project, which is scheduled to officially open on August 2.

title: Case against Hirunika Premachandra to be taken up in December
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court today (30) ordered that the case filed against former Member of Parliament Hirunika Premachandra and 14 other suspects, in connection with staging a protest by obstructing roads in the Cinnamon Gardens Police Division in 2023, be recalled on December 8.

title: Millers offered loans at 7% interest rate to purchase paddy in Yala season
byline: A concessionary pledge loan scheme for Small and Medium Scale (SME) Paddy Millers and Cooperative Societies has been introduced to purchase paddy in the 2025 Yala season.

title: Unions seek changes to labour disputes settlement process
byline: Trade unions have requested the government to take immediate steps to change the existing labour disputes settlement process.

title: Canada rescinds digital services tax to advance stalled US trade talks
byline: Canada scrapped its digital services tax targeting U.S. technology firms late on Sunday, just hours before it was due to take effect, in a bid to advance stalled trade negotiations with the United States.

title: Several senior police officers transferred and assigned to new positions
byline: Several senior police officers have been transferred and assigned to new positions with immediate effect, the Police Media Division said.

title: Easter Attacks: Case against Pujith, Hemasiri to be taken up once again in July
byline: The case filed against former Defence Secretary Hemasiri Fernando and former IGP Pujith Jayasundara before the Colombo High Court on charges of criminal negligence of duty by failing to prevent the Easter Sunday attacks despite receiving intelligence information in advance will be taken up once again on July 28.

title: Colombo inflation climbs in June
byline: The overall rate of inflation, as measured by the Colombo Consumer Price Index (CCPI) on Year-on-Year basis, has increased to -0.6% in June 2025, compared to -0.7% in May 2025, according to the latest data released by the Department of Census and Statistics.

title: Driver arrested after explosives found inside a lorry in Habarana
byline: A driver of a lorry has been arrested while transporting explosives on the Habarana – Trincomalee main road, police said.

title: Indian officials extend US visit to iron out trade deal, sources say
byline: Officials from India will extend their Washington visit to try to reach agreement on a trade deal with U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration and address lingering concerns on both sides, two Indian government sources said on Monday.

title: Legal action taken against 143 individuals on first day of Mosquito Control Week
byline: Legal action has been taken against 143 individuals on the opening day of the National Mosquito Control Week, the National Dengue Control Unit has said.

title: Opposition Leader calls on Govt to provide fair solutions to struggling SMEs
byline: Leader of the Opposition Sajith Premadasa has urged the government to immediately provide fair and just solutions to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) and entrepreneurs who are being severely impacted by the re-implementation of the parate execution laws, effective from June 30.

title: ‘Unprecedented’ alerts in France as blistering heat grips Europe
byline: A record number of heat alerts are in place across France as the country, and other parts of southern and eastern Europe, remain in the grip of soaring temperatures.

title: Parties continue to tussle over forming LG bodies
byline: The National People’s Power (NPP), the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) and the Illankai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) managed to secure power in local government institutions today (30).

title: Sri Lanka only country in Asia currently holding talks to revise Trumps’ tariffs, Minister claims
byline: Sri Lanka is the only country in the Asia region currently holding discussions with officials in the United States to revise the tariffs introduced by US President Donald Trump earlier this year, according to Deputy Minister of Economic Development Anil Jayantha Fernando.

title: Two youth arrested over murder of businessman in Maho
byline: Two individuals have been arrested in connection with the murder of a businessman whose burned body was found in a forested area in Diyabatte, Maho.

title: SLBFE statement on E-8 visa job opportunities in S. Korea and recruitment process
byline: The Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has announced that steps are underway to initiate job opportunities under the E-8 visa category for seasonal employment in South Korea.

title: Former Minister Gamini Lokuge passes away
byline: Former Minister and veteran politician Gamini Lokuge has passed away a short while ago at the age of 82, according to family sources.

title: Fuel prices increased
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) has announced a revision of fuel prices, effective from midnight today (30).
